headline: Xcel Energy Inks Dual Alliances with GE Vernova, NextEra to Support 6-GW Data Center Outlook, Generation Expansion
summary: Xcel Energy has moved to lock in supply and development capacity for what could become 6 GW of data center load through separate strategic agreements with GE Vernova and NextEra Energy, announced this week, that reserve five F-class gas turbines, multiple gigawatts of wind capacity, and joint development resources to support generation buildout into the […]

headline: GE Vernova Bolsters US Onshore Wind Fleet with 1.1 GW of Repower Orders in 2025
summary: SCHENECTADY, N.Y., February 05, 2026--GE Vernova’s Onshore Wind business announced today that it received orders in 2025 to repower 1.1 gigawatts (GW) of onshore wind turbines in the U.S. The projects will use nacelles and drive trains manufactured in the U.S. at GE Vernova’s Pensacola, Florida facility, where approximately 20 percent of the workers are veterans, supporting U.S. energy abundance, affordability, and security.

headline: Catch Up on Trump’s Breakneck Critical-Minerals Drive
summary: This week brought a blizzard of news about the Trump administration’s drive to counter China’s control over raw materials that go into everything from electric-vehicle batteries to jet fighters.  President Trump unveiled a $12 billion critical-mineral reserve: Project Vault.  Commodities trading houses signed up to provide metal, and companies including  Boeing  and gas-turbine maker  GE Vernova  endorsed the project.

headline: GE Vernova Xcel Alliance Highlights Grid Growth Potential And Valuation Tension
summary: GE Vernova (NYSE:GEV) and Xcel Energy have entered into a long term Strategic Alliance Agreement. The alliance targets grid modernization, large scale wind generation, and advanced gas turbine projects through the 2030s. The partnership includes collaboration on artificial intelligence applications and research and development for next generation energy infrastructure. For you as an investor, this alliance highlights how GE Vernova is positioning itself in generation equipment and grid...

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Tech Tantrum
summary: Tech stocks continued their selloff. Tuesday’s software rout spread Wednesday to AI-enabling stocks that had rallied a lot this year. The biggest loser in the Nasdaq-100 was chip maker Advanced Micro Devices, which fell 17% after reporting worse-than-expected results.
